timeline.message: Also update to used Node Version
Add entities for static code analysis configuration
Add repo, service, repository and first integration test
Implement update of static code analysis categories
Refactor and extend static code analysis setting validation
Read in the default configuration for static code analysis on application startup
Add integration realistic integration test with static code analysis
More integration tests for update functionality
Fix import for test cases and categories
Refactor and improve integration tests for import
Use floating point numbers for penalties to allow fine grained control
Max penalty for exercises should be integers
Create input for max static code analysis penalty
Show the max penalty in exercise details
Complete default java static code configuration

timeline.body:
```suggestion
                staticCodeAnalysisService.createDefaultCategories(newProgrammingExercise);
```
Use the correct exercise here.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
staticCodeAnalysisService.createDefaultCategories(programmingExercise);
staticCodeAnalysisService.createDefaultCategories(newProgrammingExercise);

Use the correct exercise here.
timeline.author: schultek

timeline.body: Maybe you can refactor this logic into a different method, it makes this method quite large and I guess it might be useful elsewhere.

replies.bodyText: Created a own method for the validation.
replies.author: kloessst

timeline.body: Should TAs be allowed to update the categories or is this a task that only instructors should perform?
timeline.bodyText: Should TAs be allowed to update the categories or is this a task that only instructors should perform?
timeline.bodyHTML: Should TAs be allowed to update the categories or is this a task that only instructors should perform?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: At the moment test cases can be changed also by TA. As the categories will be changed in the same view, I've chosen to use the same settings.
replies.author: kloessst

timeline.body: Just to make sure: The `@Transactional` annotation ensures that the imported SCA categories get saved into the DB although `programmingExerciseRepository.save(newExercise);` is only called before setting the categories, right?
timeline.bodyText: Just to make sure: The @Transactional annotation ensures that the imported SCA categories get saved into the DB although programmingExerciseRepository.save(newExercise); is only called before setting the categories, right?
timeline.bodyHTML: Just to make sure: The @Transactional annotation ensures that the imported SCA categories get saved into the DB although programmingExerciseRepository.save(newExercise); is only called before setting the categories, right?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: I honestly don't know why we use a Transactional here. From a DB perspective, the table storing the programming exercise doesn't have information about the categories. The reference (exercise_id) resides in the category table as usual in a 1:n relationship. The importStaticCodeAnalysisCategories uses newExercise which already contains the exercise_id after programmingExerciseRepository.save(newExercise) was called to create new categories with the right relation.
replies.author: kloessst
